t: God,*pn the nations have invaded your inheritance, desecrated*ln your holy temple, and*ln turned Jerusalem into ruins.
They*ln gave the corpses of your servants to*ln the birds of the sky for food, the*ln flesh of your faithful ones to*ln the beasts of the earth.
They*ln poured out their blood like*ln water all around Jerusalem, and*ln there was no one to bury them.
We*ln have become an object of reproach to*ln our neighbors, a*ln source of mockery and ridicule to*ln those around us.
How*pn long, Lord?*s Will you be angry forever? Will*ln your jealousy keep burning like fire?
Pour*ln out your wrath on the nations that*ln don’t acknowledge you, on*ln the kingdoms that don’t call on your name,
for*ln they have devoured Jacob and*ln devastated his homeland.
Do*ln not hold past iniquities against us; let*ln your compassion come to us quickly, for*ln we have become very weak.
God*pn of our salvation, help us, for*ln the glory of your name. Rescue*ln us and atone for our sins, for*ln your name’s sake.
Why*ln should the nations ask, “Where*ln is their God?” Before*ln our eyes, let*ln vengeance for the shed blood of your servants be*ln known among the nations.
Let*ln the groans of the prisoners reach you; according*ln to your great power, preserve*ln those condemned to die.
Pay*pn back sevenfold to our neighbors the*ln reproach they have hurled at you, Lord.
Then*ln we, your people, the sheep of your pasture, will*ln thank you forever; we*ln will declare your praise to*ln generation after generation.
